title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 April 2009 - XWiki
content:

anthony - (01/04/2009 05:23): The XWiki Date datatype (for a class's properties) -- does it support date-time or only date?

asyd - (01/04/2009 12:00): so, xwiki is bought by google?! why?  
sdumitriu - (01/04/2009 12:00): Because we have a good product  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:00): what?  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:00): really?  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:01): wow, that's great!  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:01): congrats  
sdumitriu - (01/04/2009 12:01): Do you know they bought JotSpot several years ago and turned it into Google Website?  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:01): yes  
sdumitriu - (01/04/2009 12:01): I don't know what they'll turn XWiki into  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:01): yes, u're right  
asyd - (01/04/2009 12:01): well, congrats!  
sdumitriu - (01/04/2009 12:02): Don't worry, we'll still be part of the GSoC  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 12:02): woooow  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 12:02): cool !!  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:02): when that happened?  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 12:02): and the projects will be still selected by XWiki mentors?  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:04): and do you know what are google's plans regarding XWiki?  
asyd - (01/04/2009 12:04): to have a good clock and calendar ;p  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:04): :))  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 12:05): asyd, where did u found out from?  
arunreddy - (01/04/2009 12:07): Congrats Team.!! Thats really nice to hear that google acquired XWIKI.  
sdumitriu - (01/04/2009 12:07): Hehe  
asyd - (01/04/2009 12:07): hmmm.. I wondering if I should to say it or wait a little  
sdumitriu - (01/04/2009 12:08): asyd: Wait a bit more  
asyd - (01/04/2009 12:08): ok :)  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 12:08): now i am curious :D  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 12:09): XWiki.LS was modified by XWiki.LS (Created user) - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/LS  
asyd - (01/04/2009 12:14): ok guys, I'll drink a beer this noon for this good news!  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 12:16): :))  
gwash - (01/04/2009 13:42): wow, the pirates bay has also been bought by Warner Bros.  
gwash - (01/04/2009 13:42): good news all around  
asyd - (01/04/2009 14:05): re!  
asyd - (01/04/2009 14:05): so, you all buy some googles stocks? ;p  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 14:52): XWiki.Samir was modified by XWiki.Samir (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Samir  
asyd - (01/04/2009 15:04): (so, all people here understand it was a 1st april joke ? ;p)  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 15:05): :))  
asyd - (01/04/2009 15:05): otherwhise ldubost will kick my ass ;p  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 15:06): yes asyd  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 15:06): :)  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 15:06): good one  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 15:07): hahah :))  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 15:07): you really fooled me :|  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 15:07): :P  
alexmaru - (01/04/2009 15:07): you monsters!  
asyd - (01/04/2009 15:07): :)  
arunreddy - (01/04/2009 15:09): y rilf  
arunreddy - (01/04/2009 15:09): ROFL  
anamariastoica - (01/04/2009 15:16): :)) forgot all about 1st of April   
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 15:16): i know .. me too .. i didn't get to trick anyone today :D  
ancutagheorghe - (01/04/2009 15:16): but the day is not over yet :P  
asyd - (01/04/2009 15:17): hehe  
pj\_ - (01/04/2009 15:44): hi. can anybody please tell me what are the requirements a student should have to join the project DimDim integration?  
pj\_ - (01/04/2009 15:50): can anybody provide any additonal information about the project please ?  
tachirei - (01/04/2009 17:08): GSoC: what sould I do after answering quided question from http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/student+application+form ? (Google Summer of Code sample Student Application Form)  
tachirei - (01/04/2009 17:14): ok. never mind. found it  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 19:10): XWiki.ChrisPulling was modified by XWiki.ChrisPulling (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/ChrisPulling  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 19:16): XWiki.bypeAddeguade was modified by XWiki.bypeAddeguade (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/bypeAddeguade  
harsha - (01/04/2009 20:03): Hi all  
harsha - (01/04/2009 20:04): i am having some issues regarding the photo album data model   
harsha - (01/04/2009 20:07): i thought to create a class  having photo related functions and whenever users create a new album or enter into the album it will have a reference attached and invoke methods of the class    
harsha - (01/04/2009 20:08): is it ok what i have thought here   
harsha - (01/04/2009 20:09): At the moment i have finished creating mockups of the Album application.   
harsha - (01/04/2009 20:12): Could anyone help me on this   
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 22:19): XWiki.wly was modified by XWiki.wly (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/wly  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:35): hi  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:36): is Ludovic Dubost  here ??  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:39): hi rohit, no, he is not here tonight. is it for the GSoC?  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:43): yup  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:45): which project are you interested in? maybe we can help  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:46): can i send my application for gsoc 2009 to you for review before submitting to google ?  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:46): what is the procedure ??  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:48): i am intrested in survey application...and the importance attribute is not mentioned for all the projects  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:49): once it is submitted to google, it will be reviewed by us, you'll get feedback and you'll be able to change it. If you need more details / information or are interested in a particular detail, you can use the mailing list http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists , the devs one especially  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:50): do we need to provide detail use cases in the proposa?  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:53): what it would be good to show, is that you understood the purpose of the project and its utility  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:53): whether details are important to prove it, it's your choice  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:54): but understanding is important as it would show us that you'll be able to go one step further and take initiative on the project, as well as demonstrate your autonomy  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:55): if you like a particular project but didn't quite understand its utility or purpose, take the mailing list way, get your questions answered!  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:56): thanks lucaa...one final question...  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 22:57): and of course, you should also prove you have a plan to approach the project from the technical point of view  
rohit - (01/04/2009 22:58): do we also need to talk about how to integrate the app in xwiki ??  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:00): well, particularly the survey application \_is\_ an xwiki application. So you need to build it on top of the xwiki platform  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:00): you'd actually start with integration, if I might say so  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:02): and generally, all projects are somehow tied to xwiki (technically speaking). integration is an important part of it, they should be designed with integration in mind  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:02): building a nice shiny thing and minding about integration late at the end is very very bad :)  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:03): can you suggest me a place where i should really start looking about integration ??  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:04): like some examples...  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:05): hello  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:05): can anybody read me?  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:05): how the apps are integrated in Xwiki??...from the point of source code  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:08): Can someone tell me why xwiki.com download link leads to xwiki 1.7.2 instead of a 1.8 version?  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:11): rohit: here you go, here are the xwiki tutorials http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Tutorials . especially the TODO one is useful for understanding what an xwiki application is and how it is created http://www.theserverside.com/tt/articles/article.tss?l=XWiki . Then you can look at existing xwiki applications http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/ .   
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:12): I hope these will help you understand what an xwiki application is, to guide you about how the survey application would integrate with the platform  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 23:13): Repository.WebHome was modified by xwiki:XWiki.fciubotaru - http://xoffice.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Repository/  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:14): Hey lucaa, why doesn't the xwiki.com download page link to version 1.8?  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:14): mikeyfreake: I don't think there's a particular reason for it, it just wasn't updated yet  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:15): the links look great....now its time for me to start working...thanks a lot....can i have your email id for further commnication??  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 23:15): Main.Download was modified by XWiki.fciubotaru - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:15): mikeyfreake:  but it's the same software as here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download , you can try to grab a 1.8 from there  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:17): rohit: I'm here on IRC all days, from around 9 CET to this time. You can find me on IRC if you want me particularly, but any developer here should be able to answer your questions  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:17): Thank you.  I wasn't sure if there was some problem with 1.8 (stability) or what  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:17): rohit: just make sure you mention their nickname , this way they'll be notified you talk to them  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:17): thanks lucaa...i will use IRC if in case of any questions  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:18): mikeyfreake: generally the \*.\*.1 and \*.\*.2 are more stable, since they are bugfix iterations  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:19): mikeyfreake: so, indeed, there could be a stability difference, but there's nothing particularly wrong with 1.8 :)  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:19): lucaa: are all the users in the list are developers ??  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:19): no  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:20): but users could also help you with answers  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:20): how can i identify one ???  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:21): mmh, just shoot your question in the chat (politely :) ) and someone will answer it or guide you to someone who could answer  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:21): if you need a particular developer, say his name  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:22): ok...thanks a lot..  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:22): Also, I answered an FAQ question (http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/) for someone a while ago but this page doesn't appear to get updated. So I contact someone in particular?  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:22): if a project has an estimated workload of 2 mounths, that means this project will have other deadlines than the ones estimated at 3 mounths?  
rohit - (01/04/2009 23:24): bye lucaa...  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:25): hi diana\_lungu , deadlines as in midterm and final evaluation dates? or start time?  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:26): all deadlines (midterm and final)  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 23:26): FAQ.Howcananexternalnetworkedfilebelinked was modified by XWiki.mikeyfreake (Answered) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Howcananexternalnetworkedfilebelinked  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:26): i'm asking this because i saw that most of the projects have estimated time of 3 mounths  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:28): and i'm curious if the deadlines are different depending on the estimated time  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:29): diana\_lungu: no, there are no different deadlines, it's the same for everybody in GSoC. because those deadlines are google's deadlines. The estimations are our estimations for the proposed projects  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:29): ok... thank you very much for the answer  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:30): and i have another question  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:30): on the above mentioned subject, these estimations can change as discussed with our mentors (if of course accepted)?  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:32): lucaa: I noticed that comments are not being shown on some pages with the code '#set ($showcomments="no")'.  Does this showcomments property need to be created or does it already exist?  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:33): where can i send my proposal for verification?... i mean if i want an expert opinion before updating it  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:34): diana\_lungu: you can submit your proposal on the gsoc site (choosing xwiki); you can receive feedback until the deadline  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:35): and thank you tudor\_f  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:35): we'll review it if you submit it at google, but if you have a specific question, you should shoot it on the xwiki mailing list or here  
diana\_lungu - (01/04/2009 23:37): aha... i got the idea  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:38): (it's that little 'Comment' box under our proposals we're so interested in :) )  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:39): mikeyfreake: what do you mean? if you can use it right away or you need to define it somewhere?  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:41): lucaa: Yes. Does it need to be defined first?  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:43): no  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:43): just set it to your own need  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:43): it should work  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:46): prefect. Thank you.  
mikeyfreake - (01/04/2009 23:46): Have a good day!  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:52): lucaa: still curious about those.. month estimates.. being, well approximate; by this i mean currently i have sketched my development plan around roughly 11 weeks just to make sure i don't overestimate my skills, but since the set of techologies used features a common backend, i expect that period to drop (more or less to that 8-week pre-estimate)  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:53): is this discussable with our mentors? (it's over this point i hesitate in my already submitted proposal)  
xwikibot - (01/04/2009 23:54): Main.Roadmap was modified by xwiki:XWiki.fciubotaru - http://xoffice.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:56): tudor\_f: the plan and milestones you made? yes, they are discussable. But what is the aspect you're not sure of?  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:57): if it's ok to structure my plan around 11 weeks, knowing that the pre-estimate is 8 weeks  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:57): but as i have mentioned, knowing this is just an approximation - and expecting the periods to shorten  
tudor\_f - (01/04/2009 23:58): (by pre-estimate understanding the '2 month' bit on the projects' page)  
lucaa - (01/04/2009 23:59): tudor\_f: if you think that you will need more, yes, it's ok.
